channel.title: Hunting Development :D
channel.description:
*Hunting Develpment Thread* -expect this to die fast-
I am currently, singlehandedly, working on the hunting skill. I will *try* to update this, but for now it will be simple information and pictures since I don't want to release the code yet.
--in need of some help with creating a *delete NPC* void.
:D (done) :( (to do) :)(in progress
:D basic hunting voids :D hunting timers, ints etc. :D hunting skill saves to char file :D hunting skill writes to quest tab :D First animal, hellrat, full emote, fully working timers, correct exp. :) Delete NPC voids, to delete the NPC after you catch it. :) Second animal (probably hellcats) :( Third animal (unknown) :( Fourth animal (unknown) ~All I have planned (for now)~
Pics ^^ First, Hellrats. You click on the crate, a rat ALWAYS comes out. Then, after a timer ends, you try to catch it. A randomizer (50/50) decides whether or not you are successful. If you are, you get a rat tail, and the rat SHOULD disappear, but I have no void for that yet. It send's a global message saying that #namehere# has caught a hellrat. If you don't catch it, it SHOULD disappear, and you say outloud "Damnit."
[URL=http://img353.imageshack.us/my.php?image=hunt1xc2.jpg][IMG]http://img353.imageshack.us/img353/2443/hunt1xc2.th.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img148.imageshack.us/my.php?image=hunt2og1.jpg][IMG]http://img148.imageshack.us/img148/3037/hunt2og1.th.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img353.imageshack.us/my.php?image=hunt3jx2.jpg][IMG]http://img353.imageshack.us/img353/7669/hunt3jx2.th.jpg[/img][/URL]
Hellcats next, not done yet.. but: When you use one of the hellcat options, it checks for one of three items: Raw anchovies, raw salmon, raw tuna. If you have raw anchovies, you have a ~15% chance of catching a cat. Salmon, ~30% chance. Tuna, ~50% chance. The hellcat appears in you're inventory, and SHOULD dissappear.
Updates as soon as I feel like it.

item.title: Hunting Development :D
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Not really an update, but I would be GREATFUL (Mmm…) to anyone who could help me out with the npc void. I know someone must have it, picking up cats?

Read full topic

item.title: Hunting Development :D
item.dc:creator: @mrdek11 mrdek11
item.description:
@mrdek11 wrote:

I know I managed to do this somehow with my cat system (the cat disappears when you pick it up). I’ll find it and post again

Read full topic

item.title: Hunting Development :D
item.dc:creator: @PatScape PatScape
item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

I have considered, tried, and failed at that. I attempt to refer the client.java back to the npcHandler.java voids (NPC.isDead == true)

Fails, even after defining [ i ] as the NpcID == ####, it doesn’t work correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Hunting Development :D
item.dc:creator: @mrdek11 mrdek11
item.description:
@mrdek11 wrote:

Delete as in kill? The only way I would know to do this, is to make use of the current functions to kill the npc, and just change the variable that controls the time the npc sits on the ground after death.

Read full topic

item.title: Hunting Development :D

item.description:
@PatScape wrote:

Hunting Develpment Thread
-expect this to die fast-

I am currently, singlehandedly, working on the hunting skill. I will try to update this, but for now it will be simple information and pictures since I don’t want to release the code yet.

–in need of some help with creating a delete NPC void.

basic hunting voids
hunting timers, ints etc.
hunting skill saves to char file
hunting skill writes to quest tab
First animal, hellrat, full emote, fully working timers, correct exp.
Delete NPC voids, to delete the NPC after you catch it.
Second animal (probably hellcats)
Third animal (unknown)
Fourth animal (unknown)
~All I have planned (for now)~

Pics ^^
First, Hellrats. You click on the crate, a rat ALWAYS comes out. Then, after a timer ends, you try to catch it. A randomizer (50/50) decides whether or not you are successful. If you are, you get a rat tail, and the rat SHOULD disappear, but I have no void for that yet. It send’s a global message saying that #namehere# has caught a hellrat. If you don’t catch it, it SHOULD disappear, and you say outloud “Damnit.”

Hellcats next, not done yet… but:
When you use one of the hellcat options, it checks for one of three items: Raw anchovies, raw salmon, raw tuna.
If you have raw anchovies, you have a ~15% chance of catching a cat. Salmon, ~30% chance. Tuna, ~50% chance.
The hellcat appears in you’re inventory, and SHOULD dissappear.

Updates as soon as I feel like it.
